analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha:

analyzed: masa cakkhu dibba cakkhu paññā cakkhu
translated: The eye of flesh, the divine eye, and the wisdom-eye.

original: imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi cakkhūnī”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave tīṇi cakkhūni iti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: These are the three eyes.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“The eye of flesh, the divine eye,
that the most excellent of men has declared.
The arising of the eye of flesh
is the path to the divine eye.
I was freed from all suffering.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This, too, was the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
